(The official estimate of what Sri Lanka currently owes its financiers is $64.9 billion ‚Äî $8 billion of which is owned by China. The country‚Äôs debt-to-GDP currently stands around 75% and 95.4% of all government revenue is currently going towards debt repayment. Between 2009 and 2014 Sri Lanka‚Äôs total government debt tripled and external debt doubled, as the country engaged in a number of costly undertakings. But this doesn‚Äôt necessarily mean that Sri Lanka's current administration is doing much better,under President Maithripala Sirisena and Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe. Sri Lanka may be in a debt trap that it can‚Äôt get out of. ‚Äì Fobes)

This is the reality of our country but I bet only handful people will understand this picture perfectly while 99.99% of the population has got no clue of this reality. MR & Cabral trapped us in Debt crises and Ranil with Arjuna Mahendra and Ravi K helped us to trap in currency and financial market crises. That is why we can't get out of this misery because we are being trapped in both ends. The only alternative is for this government to sell our Port City for free to compensate the debt. Last 20 years , we had so many mega projects but when it comes to GDP and its contribution, I don't think any of the projects done by MR or any of the ongoing projects under this government will have any benefits for our country other than giving them free to settle our debt. In another 20 years time, Sri Lanka will be another nominal name of the world with no value but in 20 years time, we will still be divided among colors and personalities and that is saddest part of everything.
